revisions.rev:
'''Margaritaville Cafe: Late Night''' is the name of a series of three '''[[compilation album|compilation]]''' [[album]]s by singers and bands that performed at various [[Jimmy Buffett's Margaritaville|Margaritaville Cafe]]s, commercial ventures of [[United States|American]] [[singer-songwriter]] [[Jimmy Buffett]]. The first two albums, '''''Margaritaville Cafe: Late Night Menu''''' and '''''Margaritaville Cafe: Late Night Gumbo''''' feature studio recordings including three and two songs respectively by Buffett. The third album, '''''Margaritaville Cafe: Late Night Live''''', was recorded live at Margaritaville Cafe [[New Orleans, Louisiana|New Orleans]] and is credited to [[Club Trini]], a duo of [[Michael Utley]] and [[Robert Greenidge]], two members of Buffett's [[Coral Reefer Band]], with other Coral Reefers such as [[Nadirah Shakoor]]. Buffett also appears on the album.
==''Margaritaville Cafe: Late Night Menu''==<!-- This section is linked from [[Margaritaville Cafe: Late Night Menu]] --> '''''Margaritaville Cafe: Late Night Menu''''' features studio recordings by singers and bands that performed at Margaritaville Cafe in [[Key West, Florida]]. It was released in 1993 on [[MCA Records|MCA]] 10824 and has a running time of 71:23.

Allen)</small> â 3:17 #"[[Another Saturday Night]]" â [[Jimmy Buffett]] <small>([[Sam Cooke]])</small> â 3:10 #"Everything I Say" â Rockerfellas <small>(Jim Muller, Bob Ronco)</small> â 2:15 #"India" â PM <small>(Roger Guth, Jim Mayer, Peter Mayer)</small> â 4:29 #"Pan Classique In B Minor (Mad Music)" â [[Michael Utley]] / [[Robert Greenidge]] <small>(Robert Greenidge)</small> â 4:00 #"Some White People Can Dance" â Greg "Fingers" Taylor <small>(Jimmy Buffett, Tim Krekel, Greg "Fingers" Taylor, Michael Utley)</small> â 4:03 #"Great Big Fanny" â Bill Wharton "Sauce Boss" <small>(Bill Wharton)</small> â 3:27 #"Hurtin' Kind" â Little Nicky & The Slicks <small>(Nicole Yarling)</small> â 3:25 #"Let The Big Dog Eat" â Bill Wharton "Sauce Boss" <small>(Bill Wharton)</small> â 2:35 #"Do Nothin' Man, (Don't No Woman Want A)" â Little Nicky & The Slicks <small>(Nicole Yarling)</small> â 3:56 #"Sugartown Shakedown" â Amy Lee & Nicky Yarling <small>(Amy Lee)</small> â 4:22 #"Reggae Accident" â Jimmy Buffett <small>(Lucas P. Gravell)</small> â 4:55 #"Key Lime Squeeze" â The Survivors <small>(James Allen)</small> â 4:07 #"Coco Loco" â Michael Utley / Robert Greenidge <small>(Michael Utley)</small> â 3:34 #"Souvenirs" â Jimmy Buffett <small>([[Vince Melamed]], [[Danny O'Keefe]])</small> â 3:14
==''Margaritaville Cafe: Late Night Gumbo''==<!-- This section is linked from [[Margaritaville Cafe: Late Night Gumbo]] --> '''''Margaritaville Cafe: Late Night Gumbo''''' features studio recordings by singers and bands that performed at Margaritaville Cafe in [[New Orleans, Louisiana]]. The two songs performed by Jimmy Buffett on this release, Sea Cruise and Goodnight Irene, include backing musicians Mike Utley, [[Tim Krekel]], and [[Michael Organ (drummer)|Michael Organ]]. It was released in 1995 on [[Margaritaville Records|Margaritaville]] 535012 and has a running time of 54:55.
===Track listing=== #"Don't Stop" â [[Rebirth Brass Band]] <small>(Philip Frazier)</small> â 3:43 #"Please Don't Leave Me" â Rockin' Dopsie Jr. <small>([[Fats Domino]])</small> â 3:08 #"I'm Going Down To Bourbon Street" â [[Waylon Thibodeaux]] <small>(Waylon Thibodeaux)</small> â 3:35 #"Eatin' With Fingers" â [[The Iguanas (New Orleans)|The Iguanas]] <small>(Joe Cabral)</small> â 3:31 #"[[Sea Cruise]]" â [[Jimmy Buffett]] <small>([[Huey "Piano" Smith]])</small> â 3:34 #"Stringbean" â Bluerunners <small>(Steve LeBlanc, Mark Meaux)</small> â 3:44 #"I'm Coming Home" â Rockin' Dopsie Jr. <small>([[Clifton Chenier]])</small> â 4:06 #"Come Back Baby" â Waylon Thibodeaux <small>(Waylon Thibodeaux)</small> â 3:03 #"Why Ya Whit Me" â Rebirth Brass Band <small>(Ajay Mallery, Roderick Paulin)</small> â 3:54 #"Canecutter" â Bluerunners <small>(Clifton Chenier)</small> â 4:23 #"Here's To Love" â Waylon Thibodeaux <small>(Clay Courville, Waylon Thibodeaux)</small> â 3:30 #"Popeye's A Hubigs" â Jumpin' Johnny Sansone <small>(Ricky Oliverez, Jumpin' Johnny Sansone)</small> â 2:37 #"Got You On My Mind" â The Iguanas <small>(Howard Biggs, Joe "Cornbread" Thomas)</small> â 4:30 #"Blue Co." â Bluerunners <small>(Mark Meaux)</small> â 3:07 #"[[Goodnight Irene]]" â Jimmy Buffett <small>(Leadbelly, John A. Lomax)</small> â 4:30
==''Margaritaville Cafe: Late Night Live''==<!-- This section is linked from [[Margaritaville Cafe: Late Night Live]] --> ''Margaritaville Cafe: Late Night Live'' was recorded live at Margaritaville Cafe in New Orleans, Louisiana, and was released in 2000 on [[Mailboat Records|Mailboat]] 2001 with a running time of 64:28. It is credited to Club Trini which includes Robert Greenridge (steel drums) and Michael Utley (keyboards) as well as Peter Mayer (vocals, guitar), [[Nadirah Shakoor]] (vocals), Jim Mayer (bass, background vocals), Roger Guth (drums), [[Ralph MacDonald]] (percussion), all members of Jimmy Buffett's [[Coral Reefer Band]]. Buffett himself sang and played guitar on some tracks as well. The album was produced by Utley and Greenridge.
===Track listing=== #"Viajero" <small>(Michael Utley)</small> â 6:15 #"Club Trini (Back in Town)" <small>(Robert Greenidge)</small> â 6:51 #"Soltar" <small>(Michael Utley)</small> â 6:06 #"Paradise Garden" <small>(Robert Greenidge)</small> â 4:11 #"Party Time" <small>(Robert Greenidge)</small> â 5:50 #"African Friend" <small>(Jimmy Buffett)</small> â 3:19 #"Jimmy's Intro" â 1:20 #"Come on In" <small>(Jimmy Buffett, [[Ralph MacDonald]], Bill Salter)</small> â 5:04 #"Cairo" <small>(Johnny Candoso)</small> â 3:55 #"New Orleans Medley: Storyville Parade/Ya Ya Yumbo/Shango" <small>(Michael Utley)</small> â 3:52 #"Sweet Heat" <small>(Michael Utley)</small> â 7:46 #"Madd Music" <small>(Robert Greenidge)</small> â 3:34 #"[[No Woman, No Cry]]" <small>([[Vincent Ford]], [[Bob Marley]])</small> â 6:25
